DOC.brief_summary: To study of classical conditioning mechanisms associated with arousal, craving and cocaine use.
DOC.brief_title: Development of Human Laboratory Study Model of Cocaine Relapse Prevention II - 1
DOC.detailed_description: This is a single-site, double-blind, placebo-controlled crossover study of classical conditioning mechanisms associated with arousal, craving and cocaine use.
DOC.criteria: Be Englishspeaking volunteers who are cocaine dependent Be nontreatment seeking at the time of the study Meet DSMIV criteria for cocaine dependence Have ECG showing normal sinus rhythm, normal conductivity, and non clinically significant arrhythmias Females must provide a negative pregnancy test and agree to use birth control Have baseline laboratory tests within normal limits Please contact site for more information
